intro: Euclea lancea, commonly known as the narrowleaf euclea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by woody capsules containing seeds. Euclea lancea is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in local ecosystems and traditional medicine.
